32.heading: Grinding.
32.title: Tintin in America
32.author: HergÃ©.
notes: (The Adventures of Tintin)

Summary: Tintin and Snowy arrive in Chicago, in 1931, to clean up the gangsters. Tintin is kidnapped by Al Capone, but saved by Snowy. A rival gang drugs him and throws him into Lake Michigan, but he wakes up. Many of Chicago's criminals are arrested, but Tintin pursues Bobby Smiles out west, where he and Snowy meet cowboys and Indians, strike oil, and get in a train wreck, a prairie fire, and get captured by a lynch mob. Smiles is captured, but then back in Chicago Snowy is kidnapped, and rescued, and a capitalist tries to grind both of them into corned beef, but a strike stops the factory. Tintin is kidnapped again from a banquet celebrating the victory over crime, dumped again in Lake Michigan tied to 400-pound dumbbells, which turn out to be made of wood. 355 suspects are then arrested, and Chicago's underworld is out of business.
Genre: Adventure story.

57.title: "The Merry-Go-Round Tree"
57.author: [No author]
57.series: Raggedy Ann) 10 p. in New Funnies, no. 68
notes: SUMMARY: Raggedy Ann and Andy are invited to Sunny Bunny's birthday picnic on a secret island. Inside a greenbriar are a merry-go-round and a soda fountain, "and you never have to pay for anything". While the bunnies and raggedys play, Snoopwiggy and Grinny Bear steal two of their bikes. Andy catches them and recovers the bikes. They return to the Deserted Garden where Mummie Bunnie has a surprise party waiting. I. Raggedy Ann. k. Trees. k. Parties. k. Picnics. k. 114.appears_in: 12 p. in Marvel Mystery Comics, no. 34 (Aug. 1942).
notes: Villains Grizzly Pete and Mr. Klutz are introduced and die; supplementary Nazi villains.

116.title: Grizzwells
116.author: by Bill Schorr.
116.series: Mar. 7, 1991) "Feed a Cold and Starve a Fever"*
notes: Summary: What's the difference between a cold and a fever?

117.title: Grizwells
117.author: by Bill Schorr.
117.series: Mar. 9, 1991) "But I Didn't Miss It At All"*
notes: Summary: The teacher tells Fauna that she's supposed to bring a note whenever she misses school.

118.title: Grizzwells
118.author: by Bill Schorr.
118.series: July 1, 1992) "Is This a Great Country or What?"*
notes: Summary: The animals learn that U.S. landfills will overflow by the year 2000.

119.title: Grizzwells
119.author: by Bill Schorr.
119.series: May 26, 1998) "When They Want Someone to Go Shopping for Accessories With"*
notes: Summary: Women are big on flowers, and they especially like pansies.

120.title: Grizzwells
120.author: by Bill Schorr.
notes: Summary: Two signs, and one says 'This is your park.'

121.title: Grizzwells

notes: Summary: Tuck is thinking about writing an autobiography.
